bibliography.AU: Lin, WW; Cucchiara, J; Berthelot, C; Hauet, T; Henry, Y; Katine, JA; Fullerton, EE; Mangin, S
bibliography.AF: Lin, Weiwei; Cucchiara, J.; Berthelot, C.; Hauet, T.; Henry, Y.; Katine, J. A.; Fullerton, Eric E.; Mangin, S.
bibliography.TI: Magnetic susceptibility measurements as a probe of spin transfer driven magnetization dynamics
bibliography.DE: canted spin arrangements; magnetic susceptibility; nanostructured materials; perpendicular magnetic anisotropy; spin dynamics; spin valves
bibliography.ID: ASSEMBLED METALLIC NANOSTRUCTURES; MULTILAYER; EXCITATION; REVERSAL
bibliography.AB: An experimental technique has been developed to characterize spin-transfer driven magnetization dynamics. It was tested on a nanopillar spin valve with perpendicular anisotropy by measuring the nanopillar voltage under ac injected current (dV/dI), and ac magnetic field (dV/dH). Both the amplitude and the sign of the signals are different which reveals the different influences of the current and the field on the magnetization dynamics. Comparison between experiments and macrospin simulation shows that dV/dH measurements reveal the presence of a "canted state" demonstrating that dV/dH and dV/dI measurements are complementary techniques to probe magnetic states and their dynamics. (C) 2010 American Institute of Physics. [doi:10.1063/1.3454782]
